summary: This is a service request record from Signet Technologies to relocate recorders and AMS equipment and change IP addresses for the Federal Bureau of Prisons (FBOP) Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC) in New York. The request was created on November 13, 2019, with work scheduled for November 15, 2019.

events.title: Service request creation
events.description: A service request (#26408) is created to relocate recorders and AMS equipment and change IP addresses at FBOP MCC New York.

events.title: Scheduled equipment relocation
events.description: Scheduled service work to shut down, move, and reprogram recorders and AMS equipment at FBOP MCC New York.

locations: FBOP MCC New York MS0109 (130104.001), NEW YORK, NY 10007
keyFacts: The document is a service request to relocate and reconfigure recording/AMS equipment at the Federal Bureau of Prisons Metropolitan Correctional Center in New York.
The request was made on November 13, 2019, with work scheduled for November 15, 2019.
The work involved shutting down equipment, moving it, and changing IP addresses on recorders and AMS systems.
The document references FBOP MCC New York, which is the facility where Jeffrey Epstein died in August 2019.
The timing (November 2019) places this service request approximately three months after Epstein's death in the same facility.
